title: Boglestone
text:
Boglestone (named after the Bogal Stone) is located around the top of the Clune Brae, <a href="Port%20Glasgow">Port Glasgow</a>, <a href="Inverclyde">Inverclyde</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. The area includes housing, but also serves as an important 'hub' for upper Port Glasgow, offering amenities such as education, shopping, health centres, and leisure.
The two <a href="school">school</a>s previously situated here were Boglestone Primary a non-denominational school, and <a href="St%20Michael">St Michael</a>'s a <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a> primary School. Due to the local council's education plans, Boglestone Primary was demolished, with pupils temporarily transferred to other schools, including Highholm Primary, located near Port Glasgow <a href="town%20centre">town centre</a>. Newark Primary School (opened 2008) now stands on the site.
Shops include a <a href="Co-op%20UK">Co-op</a> <a href="supermarket">supermarket</a>, <a href="newsagent">newsagent</a>s, and <a href="baker">baker</a>s, as well as <a href="Ladbrokes">Ladbrokes</a> bookmakers. A <a href="health%20centre">health centre</a>, and a <a href="community%20centre">community centre</a> that includes a <a href="gym">gym</a>, are also situated here. Boglestone shops provide a shopping centre for Boglestone, the only area of upper Port Glasgow to have close access to such a wide variety of retailers.
